intro: Haplolobus boswezensis, commonly known as the Boswezens' ghostflower, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant is notable for its unique morphology, featuring a delicate, sprawling growth habit with pale blue petals. It thrives in cool, moist microclimates and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
